intro: Acrodiclidium ita-uba, commonly known as the Ita-uba cactus, is a species native to Brazil. It is a small, spineless cactus that typically grows in rocky soils and dry environments. The plant has a short, cylindrical stem with a single, globular fruit that develops after flowering. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they bloom in the morning. The plant is adapted to arid conditions and requires minimal water once established.
